currentLevel.title: Organize Your Finances
currentLevel.description: Create a balance sheet to track your assets, liabilities, and equity

gameData.scene: Great job planning your lemonade stand! Now it's time to organize all your financial information. A balance sheet helps you see what you own (assets), what you owe (liabilities), and what's truly yours (equity). Let's organize your lemonade stand finances!
gameData.prompt: Drag and drop each financial item into the correct category. Remember: Assets = Liabilities + Equity. This equation must always balance!
hints: Assets are things your lemonade stand owns that have value (cash, equipment, supplies)
Liabilities are debts or money your lemonade stand owes to others (loans from parents, money owed to suppliers)
Equity is what you actually own - your investment and any profits you've earned
The balance sheet must balance: Total Assets = Total Liabilities + Total Equity

data.instructions: Drag each item from the left into the appropriate category on the right. Your goal is to create a balanced balance sheet for your lemonade stand business.
